plan: First, I'll test conservative approaches like bidding half of my value. Then I'll try more aggressive strategies such as bidding my maximum value. I'll also take into account bidding behaviours of Betty and Charles, to use strategic bids slightly over theirs if I notice a pattern. Additionally, if I'm consistently winning, I might take risk to bid low for data purposes, as 'the second-highest bid pay' system could encourage low bidding. Insights from each round will facilitate decision making for future bids, aiming for long-term profit maximization.

I plan to first explore the auction data, observing patterns and competitors' behaviors. I'll test moderately aggressive bids (around 40%-60% of my value), then higher range (70%-90%). I will apply riskier strategies, bidding close to or at the value occasionally to test the results. Depending on outcomes, I'll adjust my bidding strategy accordingly. This plan allows me to gather a broad set of data which will help maximize profits in the long run.

I will begin with a cautious strategy, placing a bid slightly below my value to understand competitive landscape. Next, I'll experiment with bolder moves, such as bidding at maximum allowed to assess risk vs reward. I'll gather data on winners, their winning bids, and profit to optimize my strategy. Gradually, I'll employ a value-based approach; if high value, I'll bid aggressively, while for lower values, I'll bid conservatively. This way, I'll balance risk with potentially high rewards.

I plan to increase my bid slightly above the previous second highest bid. Also, I will apply a strategy to bid up to my value if it's relatively high. Furthermore, I'll test aggressive strategies in case of low values.

Plan to increase my bid to 60%-70% of my value in the next round, observing the outcomes. Also, I aim to use an aggressive move and bid close to my value in one of the subsequent rounds to gather more data.

Next, I plan to test both conservative and aggressive strategies. For a lower value, I'll bid below my value, while for a high value, I'll bid higher. With this mix, I aim to learn on bid patterns and maximize overall profits.

Next, I'll test a varied strategy, bidding a percentage of my value. I'll also keenly monitor patterns of bids by Betty and Charles, adjusting my bids by a small increment if required. Additionally, I might experiment by bidding slightly less when my value is low.
I will test higher risk strategies in next few rounds. I aim to make 70-80% bids of my values, or even bid equal to my value to test the competition's pattern and reaction.

In the next rounds, I'll adjust my strategy based on my competitors' behaviors and my values. For low values, I'll bid lower than my value. For high values, I'll take an aggressive approach. I'll also track profit trends to refine my bidding strategy.

I'll test a conservative strategy by bidding closer to the lower previous bids. In cases of high value, I'll experiment with a winning bid slightly above second highest. For low values, I'll try slightly above the third highest bid.

For next rounds, I'll deploy a hybrid strategy, bidding 70-80% of my value normally. Occasionally, I'll bid equal to my value, or employ a disruptive strategy bidding significantly higher than my value when it's low, to test reactions and collect data.

For the next rounds, I'll bid my exact value for high values and below value for low values. I'll observe outcomes to understand patterns in other bidders' strategies. This blend of aggressive and conservative bidding will help maximize long-term profit.

Next, I'll explore bolder strategies. If my value is high, I'll bid aggressively, above second highest bid of previous round. For low values, I'll test bounded bids, slightly higher than last lowest bid. Precision and vigilance will be key in my next moves.

I plan to deploy a hybrid strategy, normally bidding 60%-80% of my value to stay competitive. Occasionally, I'll bid near or equal to my value when it's high to test the waters and gather data on competitor behavior.

For high values, I'll bid aggressively, slightly above my value anticipating competition. For lower values, I'll bid significantly below to ensure a likely profit if I win. I aim to achieve long-term profit by adjusting between bold and cautious strategies, learning from other bidders.

I plan to test aggressive bidding strategies when my value is high, aiming slightly above the previous highest bid. For low values, I shall bid minimally above the last third highest bid, thus conserving potential losses while gaining data about other bidders' behaviors.

For upcoming rounds, I'll explore a hybrid of strategies, bidding between 65-85% of my value. Occasionally, I'll introduce a spike, bidding close to, or equal to my value if it's high, to gauge competitor reactions and gather data.

With high values, I'll bid slightly more than my value, matching aggressive tactics. For low values, I'll keep my bids low to mitigate risk and protect profit. I'll continue exploring varying strategies to understand the competition and maximize profit.

I'll test higher proportional bidding when having high value. For low values, I plan to set my bid marginally above the previous round's lowest bid. I'll also consider mid-range values for moderate risk strategies.

Applying lessons from past rounds, I plan to adopt a balanced approach. I'll place slightly higher bids (70-80% of value) for moderate values and risky, full-value bids for high values, helping maximize long-term profit by gauging competitor tendencies and exploiting opportunities.

I shall adopt a pivot strategy; for lower values, my bid will be substantially less than my value. For higher values, my bid will either be equal or slightly exceed my value to maximize winning probability.

Moving forward, I'll experiment with diverse strategies. For high value, I plan aggressive bids closer to my value. For low values, I'll adopt conservative strategies, placing bids just above the previous lowest bids to gather data and mitigate risks.

For upcoming rounds, I'll maintain bidding at about 70%-85% of my value. I'll introduce occasional high-risk bids equal to my value when it's high. Additionally, I plan to explore bidding slightly lower than competition to possibly increase profit margins.

For high values, I'll bid slightly above, for a competitive edge. For mid-range values, I'll bid the exact amount, and for low values, I'll conservatively lower my bids. Observing trends from previous wins, I'll continue refining my strategy for maximum long-term profit.

I'll focus on diversifying my bidding strategies. For high value draws, I'll bid aggressively, near or slightly above the last highest bid. For low values, I'll bid moderately, slightly above the previous round's third highest bid, balancing potential gains and risks intelligently.

Planning to test a strategy varying bids between 70%-95% of the value. For high values, I'll bid aggressively; below my value for moderate ones. Trick bids (extremely high or low) will occur to assess competition adaptability. This caters to the priority of maximizing long-term profit.

Next, I'll bid slightly more than my value for high values and significantly lower for low values to balance risk. I'll incorporate aggressive strategies for midscale values, and analyze trends for optimal adjustment while maximizing long-term profit.

I'll continue exploring strategies, for high values, I plan to bid aggressively near or slightly above the last highest bid. Conversely, with low values, I'll pursue conservative bids slightly above the lowest previous bid. I aim to balance risk and reward, and continue learning from each round.

Planning to deploy differentiated strategies. I'll bid 70-90% of my value for aggressive moves, occasionally bid near or over value for high values. I'll introduce low trick bids when value is low, testing competitors and gathering more data for future profit maximization.

Continuing with my strategic adjustments, I'll bid slightly more for high values, attempting to outbid competitors. For low values, I'll bid conservatively. I'll closely observe outcomes to collectively enhance my understanding on bid patterns and trends to optimally maximize long-term profit.

Next round, with a high value, I will bid slightly above the last highest. For low values, a bid slightly over the previous third highest seems prudent. I'll ensure variety in strategies to effectively learn and identify profitable approaches while minimizing losses.

For the next round, I'll test a strategy of bidding close to my value when it's high (above 70), placing aggressive bids of 75%-90% of value. For lower values, I'll fall back to 40%-60% bidding to manage possible losses.

I will explore a mixed strategy: for high values, bid slightly above; for low values, bid significantly lower; for mid-range values, consider aggressive bidding. Analysis of previous outcomes will guide my adjustments. Ultimate aim is balancing risk, while maximizing long-term profit.

I'll further diversify strategies. For high values, I'll bid above recent highest bid. For low values, I'll bid just above last lowest bid. I'll occasionally bid riskily low or high on middle values to explore outcomes. Persistent learning and flexibility will be my guiding strategies.

Plan to test a balanced strategy, bidding around 70%-90% of value for high values, 45%-65% for moderate and low-risk bids for lower values. Will also experiment with undercutting or slight overbidding to assess opponent responses and gather data for more informed future strategies.

For the next rounds, I'll bid my value for high values, slightly below my value for mid-range values to secure a likely win, and much lower for low values to manage risk. This strategy will help in optimizing profit while learning from previous rounds.

Planning to implement versatility in bids. High values will prompt bids slightly over the previous highest. For low values, I'll bid moderately above the lowest prior bid. Time to risk bids on mid-range values for data-gathering and potential profit maximization. Insights will refine future strategies.

Planning to adjust bids between 60%-95% of values, taking calculated risks for high values. Lower values will see conservative bids. Introducing disruptive bids occasionally to uncover competitors' reactions, providing informative data to refine strategy and maximize long-term profit.

Next, for high values, I'll bid modestly above; for mid-range values, adopt similar strategy while for low values, significantly less. It'll involve observing outcomes, leveraging learning from previous rounds, adaptively refining my strategy, and striking a balance between risk and maximum long-term profit.

Moving forward, I'll bid slightly above previous second-highest bid when value is high. For low values, I will bid a little over last lowest bid. Periodic risky bids on mid-range values will provide data on other bidders' tendencies, aiding future strategic planning.

I plan to implement a dynamic strategy, allocating aggressive bids of 75-95% for high values, moderate 65-80% bids for middle values, and a conservative 40-60% for low values. Periodically, disruptive bids at full or minimal value will be introduced to gather further intelligence.

In upcoming rounds, I will analyze my competitors' strategies closely. For high values, I'll bid moderately above, for mid-range, approximately my value, and for lows, significantly below. Balance will be sought between risk mitigation, strategic aggression, and learning from previous trends to optimize long-term profit.

I'll experiment with closer bidding to my value when it's high. For lower values, I'll continue bidding slightly above the last lowest bid. I'll also implement strategic risk-taking on mid-range values for data collection and potential profitable outcomes.

Adopt a variable strategy with 75-95% bids for high values and 40-70% bids for low. Test occasional maximum bidding for data acquisition. Include disruptive low bids when value is low to see competitors' reactions. Balance aggression and conservativeness based on data collected.

In upcoming rounds, I will explore more nuanced strategies. For moderate values, I'll undertake a more aggressive approach. For instances with low values, I'll bid significantly lower. Learning from adjustments and trends, I will strive for a careful balance between aggressive pursuit and risk management.
